intro: Clidemia globuliflora, commonly known as the globular-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellow flowers. The plant has small, ovate leaves and produces berries that are often consumed by birds, aiding in seed dispersal. It typically grows on the branches of host trees, deriving some of its nutrients from them. Its ecological role includes providing food for various bird species and contributing to the biodiversity of forest ecosystems.
